guild.description:
See a bug while using Ruqqus? File it here and we'll open an issue for the Ruqqus devs to resolve. Before posting, look around first to see if the bug hasn't already been filed. If so, just upvote it or leave a comment to show your support. When a bug is resolved, the status will be reported back in the original thread.

Please only use this guild to file _bugs_. For suggestions or feature requests, use +Ruqqus or +BetaFeedback.

post.body:
For the third update of the week, we've broken up guildmaster permissions into a set of granular options that can be toggled on or off for any particular guildmaster. If you've ever moderated on a certain alien-themed Ruqqus clone, you'll be familiar with the overall concept.

There are four categories of guildmaster permissions:

* **access** - Manage the exile and approved contributor lists
* **appearance** - Manage guild artwork and color
* **config** - Manage guild settings and description
* **content** - Kick, yank, pin, herald

Additionally, there is also **full** permissions, which is all of the above, plus the ability to invite new GMs, revoke invitations, and change permissions on GMs below you on the list.

All GMs are defaulting to Full permissions, since that's effectively what they were before this update.

By adding granular permissions, you should be able to recruit new guildmasters as needed, without the risk that they might add new guildmasters of their own or vandalize the guild.

Since this update is hot off the presses, you may need to press Ctrl-Shift-R (command-shift-R for mac) in order to load new site javascript.
post.body_html:
For the third update of the week, we've broken up guildmaster permissions into a set of granular options that can be toggled on or off for any particular guildmaster. If you've ever moderated on a certain alien-themed Ruqqus clone, you'll be familiar with the overall concept.

There are four categories of guildmaster permissions:

  • access - Manage the exile and approved contributor lists
  • appearance - Manage guild artwork and color
  • config - Manage guild settings and description
  • content - Kick, yank, pin, herald

Additionally, there is also full permissions, which is all of the above, plus the ability to invite new GMs, revoke invitations, and change permissions on GMs below you on the list.

All GMs are defaulting to Full permissions, since that's effectively what they were before this update.

By adding granular permissions, you should be able to recruit new guildmasters as needed, without the risk that they might add new guildmasters of their own or vandalize the guild.

Since this update is hot off the presses, you may need to press Ctrl-Shift-R (command-shift-R for mac) in order to load new site javascript.
post.title: Ruqqus 2.29 - Guildmaster Permissions

body: I think you're underestimating nature unfortunately. Some of my friends constantly make god-like accomplishments fairly easily, often without even thinking about it, while I struggle to even do one thing 1/4 as well in much more time. We've all had the same ambition and experience, but our results are vastly different. I feel like nurture is only about 25% of the story, the vast majority of it is how you were born. It's been proven that adopted children are *much* more like their biological parents than their adoptive ones, even if they've never met the former. This world is unfair shit.

parent.body:
well, if it *is* DNA, they have no right to feel either proud or ashamed of it nor should others ask them to feel either of those ways.  No one on this planet has control over their DNA. Shame and pride should be reserved for things we as individuals did all by ourselves - instead of accidents of birth. 
I guess there are some cases where DNA played a role, but I still think most are nurture, not nature.
Sad about that boarding school upbringing.  I'd rather cut my leg off than let my young child grow up away from me or his/her family. Over age 12...maybe....if the kid BEGGED me.

parent.body:
I've read and agree with that study about DNA and adoptive families/biology.  Life seems unfair and often is.  Just remember that some people are born with lower IQs, some with uglier faces, some with evil parents, some born into dangerous neighborhoods...There are many types of unfairness.  That beautiful little girl may be getting raped by her step brother once a week or that great baseball player in high school may get beaten up by his dad if he strikes out in a game. 
People envy Ted Turner, but I read his biography and knew a woman who worked for him: he was placed in a boarding home at age 7.  Fricking SEVEN!  What asswipe of a parent puts their kids elsewhere at that tender age?! So, his dad being rich didn't help his childhood much.  Later his dad committed suicide and later Ted himself struggled with alcoholism and suicidal thoughts. My point is that we always think the other side has it better.  Sometimes it *does*, but oftentimes people don't wear their weakness on their sleeves. *YOU* might think they have it *better*, but *better* is subjective.  Look at all of the trust fund kids ODing and those celebrities, too. They cannot handle reality and so try to drown it out with drugs.  From afar it may seem like they are partying and having fun, but they are trying to escape reality. There are 2 sides to every coin.  Fame and fortune bring out jealous people who want to take away what you have.

Just remember that some people are born with lower IQs, some with uglier faces, some with evil parents, some born into dangerous neighborhoods...There are many types of unfairness. That beautiful little girl may be getting raped by her step brother once a week or that great baseball player in high school may get beaten up by his dad if he strikes out in a game. People envy Ted Turner, but I read his biography and knew a woman who worked for him: he was placed in a boarding home at age 7. Fricking SEVEN! What asswipe of a parent puts their kids elsewhere at that tender age?! So, his dad being rich didn't help his childhood much. Later his dad committed suicide and later Ted himself struggled with alcoholism and suicidal thoughts. My point is that we always think the other side has it better. Sometimes it does, but oftentimes people don't wear their weakness on their sleeves. YOU might think they have it better, but better is subjective. Look at all of the trust fund kids ODing and those celebrities, too. They cannot handle reality and so try to drown it out with drugs. From afar it may seem like they are partying and having fun, but they are trying to escape reality. There are 2 sides to every coin. Fame and fortune bring out jealous people who want to take away what you have.

parent.body: My badges are out of order now (first one I got was Beta User, last was Idea Maker), but at least they're still in a silver-gold pattern. I was just lucky to have earned the first 3 in order of descending ids. If I really wanted to maintain that gold-silver pattern, I can't recruit anyone, and I'd have to either become a Game Night Finalist or get the Artisan badge.
parent.body_html: My badges are out of order now (first one I got was Beta User, last was Idea Maker), but at least they're still in a silver-gold pattern. I was just lucky to have earned the first 3 in order of descending ids. If I really wanted to maintain that gold-silver pattern, I can't recruit anyone, and I'd have to either become a Game Night Finalist or get the Artisan badge.

body:
So you did this with no experience and it's *perfect*, with not even one tiny mistake. As always. And I can tell you didn't use powerpoint this time because there's no antialiasing.

I don't know how you're so perfect at everything automatically. I suspect it's just an inborn quality that I'll never have. Maybe there's still some positives to that, hopefully.

Edit: I don't know why I keep doing this. I'm just ruining everyone else's good times with my pity party, including yours. This is my problem, not anyone else's. Sorry for bothering you.

parent.body:
I saw the Ruqqie reaction gifs on Trending a while back.

>How was this made

Because I have no real animation program, I drew this frame by frame, and then I found an online gif converter. I found the official picture of Ruqqie, and I tried my best to replicate it. Then I tried to draw the first frame, the frame where Ruqqie is lowest, and the frame where Ruqqie is highest. Then I copied and pasted these frames over and over again, and I tried to animate the legs first. Then I made Ruqqie move up and down to see how it looked (and figure out how many frames it should have), and then I tried to redraw the legs in some frames if they looked weird and animate the arms. Then I made Ruqqie still again (no up and down motion because it's easier to make the eyes and mouth stay in place), and I tried to animate the eyes and mouth. Then I drew the hat, and I copied and pasted it into all the frames. Then I re-added the up and down motion, and I tried to get the hat to move.

Since I have no real animation program, I'm not sure how you're actually supposed to animate things. I just looked at the previous frames (and sometimes copied and pasted parts of them into the next frame) to determine how to draw the next frame, and I played it over and over again to see if it looked ok .

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>
parent.body_html:
I saw the Ruqqie reaction gifs on Trending a while back.

How was this made

Because I have no real animation program, I drew this frame by frame, and then I found an online gif converter. I found the official picture of Ruqqie, and I tried my best to replicate it. Then I tried to draw the first frame, the frame where Ruqqie is lowest, and the frame where Ruqqie is highest. Then I copied and pasted these frames over and over again, and I tried to animate the legs first. Then I made Ruqqie move up and down to see how it looked (and figure out how many frames it should have), and then I tried to redraw the legs in some frames if they looked weird and animate the arms. Then I made Ruqqie still again (no up and down motion because it's easier to make the eyes and mouth stay in place), and I tried to animate the eyes and mouth. Then I drew the hat, and I copied and pasted it into all the frames. Then I re-added the up and down motion, and I tried to get the hat to move.

Since I have no real animation program, I'm not sure how you're actually supposed to animate things. I just looked at the previous frames (and sometimes copied and pasted parts of them into the next frame) to determine how to draw the next frame, and I played it over and over again to see if it looked ok .

- sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, don't censor my username]

guild.description:
A Ruqqus guild for collecting materials which promote positive changes in your life and the lives of others. Life skills, goals, and motivation are all here. We spend lots of time knocking each other down, and getting into heated discussions, so this is a place for improving yourself.

I'm pretty lax with rules, just don't go around calling people insults. Self-improvement stories, questions, and discussions are allowed. Members are encouraged to build each other up, and save each other from blackpill and doomer mentalities. This guild is a place for positivity, so we can break out of negative thinking and stop blackpilling ourselves.

body: Yeah I get better at stuff too but it's not perfect like yours is. I still never get anywhere close to perfect no matter how much improvement I make. I just don't automatically figure everything out like that. It takes years of experience for me to even do 1/4 of what you do just barely touching on something, and not as perfectly either and with more time spent on it. I've noticed there's 2 types of people generally, some everything just comes naturally for them and they can do pretty much anything really well and know almost everything, and some just have to do their best and accept "ok" results (I'm one of the few in this category with our personality, which is why it's so bothersome for me).

I just don't automatically figure everything out like that. It takes years of experience for me to even do 1/4 of what you do just barely touching on something, and not as perfectly either and with more time spent on it. parent.body:
>So you did this with no experience

I've been trying to make similar types of animations (without a real animation program...) for several years now. I just don't really post anything online.

>And I can tell you didn't use powerpoint

I did use PowerPoint to draw the frames. The lack of antialiasing around the edges is because of the gif conversion site.

I'm not "perfect at everything automatically". I do have some experience, and I think that I do get better over time with practice.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>

I'm not "perfect at everything automatically". I do have some experience, and I think that I do get better over time with practice.

guild.description:
See a bug while using Ruqqus? File it here and we'll open an issue for the Ruqqus devs to resolve. Before posting, look around first to see if the bug hasn't already been filed. If so, just upvote it or leave a comment to show your support. When a bug is resolved, the status will be reported back in the original thread.

Please only use this guild to file _bugs_. For suggestions or feature requests, use +Ruqqus or +BetaFeedback.
guild.description_html:
See a bug while using Ruqqus? File it here and we'll open an issue for the Ruqqus devs to resolve. Before posting, look around first to see if the bug hasn't already been filed. If so, just upvote it or leave a comment to show your support. When a bug is resolved, the status will be reported back in the original thread.

Please only use this guild to file bugs. For suggestions or feature requests, use +Ruqqus or +BetaFeedback.
guild.name: RuqqusBugs

body:
> shrug it off and just be happy right here and now.

lol I wish

> Also people you think seem perfect are also full of insecurity doubts and existential dread

Don't think I'm not too. The difference is they are at least capable enough to do some fun things, and I'm not, all I can do is just sit here failing and watching them do everything right just automatically. I'm not a normal person, the problem is I am one of those people myself, but I don't even get to have the results.

> hardships make us stronger.

In this case it's obviously only hindering me, since the people who have it easy are light years ahead of me almost instantly, even if I've been at something for a really long time. So I doubt this is one of those things that makes me stronger.

parent.body: If you feel completely hopeless about achieving your personal standards for happiness that is all the more reason to shrug it off and just be happy right here and now. Also people you think seem perfect are also full of insecurity doubts and existential dread, there is no such thing as an easy life and hardships make us stronger. Merry Christmas bro!

body:
> I think you need to find out how YOU are uniquely special

That's the thing, I'm not. I'm just ok at everything and that's as far as I will ever get. I have no strengths or advantages of my own. Even if I do, which I haven't seen any of yet, it must be something I hate doing. Yet these other people are automatically perfect, and I mean *perfect* at not just one or two things, but nearly *everything*. The stuff I've been obsessed with for years, they will blow me away just starting out or barely being interested in it. And I'm not even good enough at anything to accomplish barely anything decent at all, let alone with almost no faults at all in such little amount of time with such little experience.
body_html:
I think you need to find out how YOU are uniquely special

That's the thing, I'm not. I'm just ok at everything and that's as far as I will ever get. I have no strengths or advantages of my own. Even if I do, which I haven't seen any of yet, it must be something I hate doing. Yet these other people are automatically perfect, and I mean perfect at not just one or two things, but nearly everything. The stuff I've been obsessed with for years, they will blow me away just starting out or barely being interested in it. And I'm not even good enough at anything to accomplish barely anything decent at all, let alone with almost no faults at all in such little amount of time with such little experience.

Rules:

If you do a thing here you will be BEN.

I tweeted POTUS, but got no response.

Thou shalt not deny the glory of Lord Steven Christ.

NO NICKELBACK

Goddamn it feels good to be a gangster.

parent.body: Life is unfair sometimes. Pity or bitterness/jealous will not get you farther in life.  I think you need to find out how YOU are uniquely special and try to create a job around that.  Start it as a hobby, then figure out a way to make money from it.  Don't try to be like others.  Compete against YOURSELF. Life would be boring as hell if everyone copied each other.

Start it as a hobby, then figure out a way to make money from it. Don't try to be like others. Compete against YOURSELF. Life would be boring as hell if everyone copied each other.
